channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: History Today: When Nehru spoke for a new India for first time at UN
FirstUp: Hegseth to visit South Korea and other big headlines of the day
Get artsy: How creativity might slow down the brain from ageing
What is ‘vibe working’? Is it the future of AI productivity?
This Week in Explainers: What is Russia’s Burevestnik missile that prompted US to resume nuclear testing?
History Today: How King Saud Al Saud was dethroned after a coup in Saudi Arabia
India-US defence deal: Washington must realise benefits of Delhi's strategic autonomy
item.description: May America realise the favourable outcomes of India’s strategic autonomy and want to ensure it stays in India’s procurement and technology demand game

item.title: Next Ayatollah? Why Yunus is targeting Bangladesh Army
item.description: History offers abundant warnings about leaders who claim revolutionary legitimacy as justification for extra-constitutional authority, but what followed was not democracy but theocratic authoritarianism

item.title: India-US defence deal signals strategic interests trump temporary frictions
item.description: As Rajnath Singh and Pete Hegseth ink a new ten-year defence framework in Kuala Lumpur, Delhi signals continuity without capitulation—and Washington discovers that partnership, not pressure, will define the next phase

item.title: How Trump’s revival of G2 ghost is self-defeating for the US
item.description: More than the implications for India, the term casts the US in a poor light—as a power whose imperial sun is finally setting, one that has subtly conceded ground to its principal challenger while reminding allies why Washington can never be trusted

item.title: How Pakistan’s Afghan policy has become Rawalpindi’s Frankenstein
item.description: Pakistan’s aspirations to have a patron-client relationship with the Taliban have now backfired, and there is no antidote available to counter it

item.title: Happy Halloween: India’s ‘haunted’ heritage that keeps legends alive all year
item.description: Perhaps it's the most appropriate time of the year to have a bit of fun and speak about a few heritage sites in India which have the sad reputation of being haunted by spirits
